title: False Dilemma
description:
John Corvino explains the fallacy of false dilemma, in which an argument forces a conclusion while leaving key options off the table.

Dr. John Corvino is a speaker, writer, philosophy professor, and Dean of the Irvin D. Reid Honors College at Wayne State University in Detroit. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

John Corvino's Better Argument series was filmed at Wayne State University by James Wright and Mayabeth Jagosz, with funding from the American Philosophical Association.

title: Begging the Question
description:
What does it mean for an argument to “beg the question”? John Corvino explains.

Dr. John Corvino is a speaker, writer, philosophy professor, and Dean of the Irvin D. Reid Honors College at Wayne State University in Detroit. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

John Corvino's Better Argument series was filmed at Wayne State University by James Wright and Mayabeth Jagosz, with funding from the American Philosophical Association.

title: Why study philosophy?
description:
Why study philosophy? Drawing on a favorite story (from a cookbook!) John Corvino offers a multitude of reasons.

Dr. John Corvino is a speaker, writer, philosophy professor, and Dean of the Irvin D. Reid Honors College at Wayne State University in Detroit. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

John Corvino's Better Argument series was filmed at Wayne State University by James Wright and Mayabeth Jagosz, with funding from the American Philosophical Association.

title: No True Scotsman
description:
John Corvino explains the “No True Scotsman” fallacy, also known as “moving the goalposts.”

Dr. John Corvino is a speaker, writer, philosophy professor, and Dean of the Irvin D. Reid Honors College at Wayne State University in Detroit. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

John Corvino's Better Argument series was filmed at Wayne State University by James Wright and Mayabeth Jagosz, with funding from the American Philosophical Association.

title: Ad Hominem
description:
What does it mean for an argument to be “ad hominem,” and why is that bad? John Corvino explains.

Dr. John Corvino is a speaker, writer, philosophy professor, and Dean of the Irvin D. Reid Honors College at Wayne State University in Detroit. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

John Corvino's Better Argument series was filmed at Wayne State University by James Wright and Mayabeth Jagosz, with funding from the American Philosophical Association.

title: Deepities
description:
John Corvino explains philosopher Daniel Dennett’s concept of “Deepities”—claims that look deep, but only because they’re ambiguous.

Dr. John Corvino is a speaker, writer, philosophy professor, and Dean of the Irvin D. Reid Honors College at Wayne State University in Detroit. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

John Corvino's Better Argument series was filmed at Wayne State University by James Wright and Mayabeth Jagosz, with funding from the American Philosophical Association.

title: The Fact/Opinion Distinction
description:
Lots of people have tried to explain the difference between facts and opinions. John Corvino explains why the distinction is messy and not very useful.

Dr. John Corvino is a speaker, writer, philosophy professor, and Dean of the Irvin D. Reid Honors College at Wayne State University in Detroit. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

John Corvino's Better Argument series was filmed at Wayne State University by James Wright and Mayabeth Jagosz, with funding from the American Philosophical Association.

title: Slippery-Slope Arguments
description:
John Corvino explains how to evaluate slippery-slope arguments.

Dr. John Corvino is a speaker, writer, philosophy professor, and Dean of the Irvin D. Reid Honors College at Wayne State University in Detroit. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

John Corvino's Better Argument series was filmed at Wayne State University by James Wright and Mayabeth Jagosz, with funding from the American Philosophical Association.

title: Analogies and False Equivalence
description:
John Corvino explains why arguments from analogy can be tricky, especially if they suggest a false equivalence between actions that are morally quite different.

Dr. John Corvino is a speaker, writer, philosophy professor, and Dean of the Irvin D. Reid Honors College at Wayne State University in Detroit. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

John Corvino's Better Argument series was filmed at Wayne State University by James Wright and Mayabeth Jagosz, with funding from the American Philosophical Association.

title: Equivocation
description:
John Corvino explains the fallacy of equivocation, wherein the meaning of a term shifts mid-argument.

Dr. John Corvino is a speaker, writer, philosophy professor, and Dean of the Irvin D. Reid Honors College at Wayne State University in Detroit. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

John Corvino's Better Argument series was filmed at Wayne State University by James Wright and Mayabeth Jagosz, with funding from the American Philosophical Association.

title: The Principle of Charity
description:
Why should we give people the benefit of the doubt when assessing their arguments, instead of setting up "straw men" (or "straw persons")? John Corvino explains the principle of charity.

Dr. John Corvino is a speaker, writer, philosophy professor, and Dean of the Irvin D. Reid Honors College at Wayne State University in Detroit. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

John Corvino's Better Argument series was filmed at Wayne State University by James Wright and Mayabeth Jagosz, with funding from the American Philosophical Association.

title: The Use of Experts
description:
People are often mistrustful of authority these days. John Corvino explains why--and to what extent--expertise matters.

Dr. John Corvino is a speaker, writer, philosophy professor, and Dean of the Irvin D. Reid Honors College at Wayne State University in Detroit. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

John Corvino's Better Argument series was filmed at Wayne State University by James Wright and Mayabeth Jagosz, with funding from the American Philosophical Association.

title: What makes an argument valid?
description:
In philosophical logic, the term "valid" has a precise meaning. John Corvino explains it here.

Dr. John Corvino is a speaker, writer, philosophy professor, and Dean of the Irvin D. Reid Honors College at Wayne State University in Detroit. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

John Corvino's Better Argument series was filmed at Wayne State University by James Wright and Mayabeth Jagosz, with funding from the American Philosophical Association.

title: Race Restrictions: Just a Preference? - John Corvino
description:
On Grindr, Tinder, Scruff, and other dating apps, people often put racial restrictions such as “No blacks” or “No Asians.” John Corvino explains why that’s a problem.

Dr. John Corvino is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He has written several books for Oxford University Press, including, most recently, Debating Religious Liberty and Discrimination (with counterpoint by Ryan T. Anderson and Sherif Girgis).

Video by Chase Whiteside. Special thanks to Amir Brown (not really a Republican). Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Bakers, Freedom, & the Law - John Corvino
description:
Bakers, florists, and other wedding-service providers sometimes balk at anti-discrimination law, citing the importance of “freedom.” John Corvino explains how such laws protect access and promote inclusion.

Dr. John Corvino is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He has written several books for Oxford University Press, including, most recently, Debating Religious Liberty and Discrimination (with counterpoint by Ryan T. Anderson and Sherif Girgis).

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/2ozZABp
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: FADA & the Puritan Mistake - John Corvino
description:
John Corvino explains why First Amendment Defense Acts, or FADAs, betray not only the spirit of the First Amendment but also the United States’ rich legacy of religious liberty.

Dr. John Corvino is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He has written several books for Oxford University Press, including, most recently, Debating Religious Liberty and Discrimination (with counterpoint by Ryan T. Anderson and Sherif Girgis).

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/2ozZABp
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: What's Wrong with Wedding Discrimination? - John Corvino
description:
Some people claim that bakers, florists, and even public officials who refuse to serve same-sex weddings are not really discriminating on the basis of sexual orientation. But they are, and John Corvino explains why.

Dr. John Corvino is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He has written several books for Oxford University Press, including, most recently, Debating Religious Liberty and Discrimination (with counterpoint by Ryan T. Anderson and Sherif Girgis).

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/2ozZABp
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: The Fuss about RFRA - John Corvino
description:
Religious Freedom Restoration Acts, or RFRAs, can protect religious liberty, but they can also license religious privilege and discrimination. John Corvino explains the problem.

Dr. John Corvino is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He has written several books for Oxford University Press, including, most recently, Debating Religious Liberty and Discrimination (with counterpoint by Ryan T. Anderson and Sherif Girgis).

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/2ozZABp
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Respecting Integrity & Conscience - John Corvino
description:
John Corvino explains that respecting people’s convictions doesn’t require sanctioning their discriminatory  behavior.

Dr. John Corvino is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He has written several books for Oxford University Press, including, most recently, Debating Religious Liberty and Discrimination (with counterpoint by Ryan T. Anderson and Sherif Girgis).

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/2ozZABp
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Bathroom Bills - John Corvino
description:
John Corvino explains why “Bathroom Bills,” which require people to use the restroom corresponding with the sex on their birth-certificate, are short-sighted, counterproductive, and harmful.

Dr. John Corvino is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He has written several books for Oxford University Press, including, most recently, Debating Religious Liberty and Discrimination (with counterpoint by Ryan T. Anderson and Sherif Girgis).

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/2ozZABp
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: John Corvino: 25 Years
description: To commemorate 25-year anniversary of his lecture "What's Morally Wrong with Homosexuality?" and his work for equality more generally, John Corvino was honored with the inaugural “Community Hero Award” at the Affirmations Spring Bash in Detroit on March 18, 2017. This compilation video was shown at the event. Edited by Christian Hendricks.

title: "Natural" Purpose and the Coke Analogy, 1992 - John Corvino
description: On April 15, 1992, at the University of Texas at Austin, John first delivered the lecture "What's Morally Wrong with Homosexuality?", which launched his career as a speaker and advocate. Here's a clip.

title: John Corvino - What's Morally Wrong with Homosexuality? (Full DVD Video)
description:
In this widely presented lecture (recorded here in 2007), John Corvino dismantles common arguments against same-sex relationships, including those based on nature, harm, and religion.

And if you like the lecture, you'll love the book!: http://johncorvino.com/whats-wrong-with-homosexuality/

Special thanks for subtitle translations:
Czech by David Koranda.
Polish by Stanley Bulski.
Portuguese (Brazilian) by Luiz Henrique Soares Silva. 
Spanish by Pedro Michel, Dr. Paula Oliva-Fiori, and Dr. Roxana Zuniga.
Chinese (Traditional and Simplified) by Chen.

Dr. John Corvino is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the author of What's Wrong with Homosexuality? and the co-author (with Maggie Gallagher) of Debating Same-Sex Marriage and (with Ryan T. Anderson and Sherif Girgis) of Debating Religious Liberty and Discrimination, all from Oxford University Press.

Find the book version here: http://amzn.to/ZuIF2A.
Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Homosexuality & The Bible 1: God Said It, I Believe It, That Settles It - John Corvino
description:
John Corvino discusses some Bible verses from both the Hebrew and Christian Scriptures, explores analogies to slavery and divorce, and points out the inconsistencies of those who cherry-pick the apparently anti-gay parts of the Bible while glossing over other problematic passages. (Passages read from New Revised Standard Version.)

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the author of What's Wrong with Homosexuality? and the co-author (with Maggie Gallagher) of Debating Same-Sex Marriage, both from Oxford University Press.

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIF2A.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Homosexuality & the Race Analogy - John Corvino
description:
Many LGBT rights advocates have drawn inspiration from the civil rights movement for African-Americans. In response, social conservatives often object that the analogy is illegitimate, because race is "non-behavioral" whereas homosexuality is a "chosen lifestyle." Here John Corvino explains why this response misunderstands the nature of racism, the nature of homophobia, and the connections between the two.

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the author of What's Wrong with Homosexuality? and the co-author (with Maggie Gallagher) of Debating Same-Sex Marriage, both from Oxford University Press.

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIF2A.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Risky Lifestyle? - John Corvino
description: John Corvino responds to those who blame homosexuality for disease, misery, and despair, ultimately turning the tables on those who wield morality as a weapon.

title: Homosexuality & The Bible 2: Sodom and Gomorrah - John Corvino
description:
John Corvino explains the real lessons from the Sodom and Gomorrah story, the Biblical passage perhaps most often cited against homosexual conduct. (Passages read from New Revised Standard Version.)

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the author of What's Wrong with Homosexuality? and the co-author (with Maggie Gallagher) of Debating Same-Sex Marriage, both from Oxford University Press.

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIF2A.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: It Gets Better - John Corvino
description:
John Corvino tells his own coming-out story and explains why he does the work that he does as The Gay Moralist.

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the author of What's Wrong with Homosexuality? and the co-author (with Maggie Gallagher) of Debating Same-Sex Marriage, both from Oxford University Press.

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIF2A.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Where Does Morality Come From? - John Corvino
description:
Is it possible to have a foundation for moral beliefs without appealing to Scripture? John Corvino argues that it is, making a plea for humility from all parties in the debate. At the same time, he challenges his fellow liberals to reject the claim that "morality is a private matter."

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the author of What's Wrong with Homosexuality? and the co-author (with Maggie Gallagher) of Debating Same-Sex Marriage, both from Oxford University Press.

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIF2A.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: The Purpose of Sex: Masturbation, Aquinas, & New Natural Law - John Corvino
description:
John Corvino discusses the views of the 13th Century philosopher St. Thomas Aquinas and some of his intellectual heirs today—self-styled "new natural lawyers" like Robert George of Princeton—who provide the intellectual basis for much of contemporary social conservative thought.

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the author of What's Wrong with Homosexuality? and the co-author (with Maggie Gallagher) of Debating Same-Sex Marriage, both from Oxford University Press.

Find the book here: http://amzn.com/0199856311.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the author of What's Wrong with Homosexuality? and the co-author (with Maggie Gallagher) of Debating Same-Sex Marriage, both from Oxford University Press.

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIF2A.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Love the Sinner / Hate the Sin - John Corvino
description:
John Corvino explains the problem with the standard "Love the Sinner/Hate the Sin" line, while also rejecting simplistic distinctions between homosexual orientation and homosexual conduct. He concludes with a message to religious conservatives who want to express their love for LGBT people while still maintaining that same-sex relations are sinful.

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the author of What's Wrong with Homosexuality? and the co-author (with Maggie Gallagher) of Debating Same-Sex Marriage, both from Oxford University Press.

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIF2A.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Born This Way? - John Corvino
description:
John Corvino neither knows nor cares whether he was born gay. In this video he explains how the obsession with "born this way" depends on scientific and moral confusion.

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the author of What's Wrong with Homosexuality? and the co-author (with Maggie Gallagher) of Debating Same-Sex Marriage, both from Oxford University Press.

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIF2A.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: LGBTQrstuv: Bisexuality & Transgender - John Corvino
description:
Sometimes the "alphabet soup" of LGBTQ etc. can seem confusing. Here John Corvino explains some basic distinctions between sexual orientation and gender identity while making a few observations about bisexuality and transgender.

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the author of What's Wrong with Homosexuality? and the co-author (with Maggie Gallagher) of Debating Same-Sex Marriage, both from Oxford University Press.

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIF2A.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Anal Sex - John Corvino
description:
John Corvino addresses those who seem to think there's nothing more to gay sex than anal sex and explains how squeamish visceral reactions can sometimes masquerade as moral judgments.

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the author of What's Wrong with Homosexuality? and the co-author (with Maggie Gallagher) of Debating Same-Sex Marriage, both from Oxford University Press.

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIF2A.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Are People Who Oppose Gay Marriage Bigots? - John Corvino
description:
Many marriage-equality supporters believe that it's a mistake to engage opponents— that these opponents are bigots, and that engaging them tends to legitimize bigotry. John Corvino explains why it's important to keep the conversation going.

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the co-author, with Maggie Gallagher, of the book Debating Same-Sex Marriage (Oxford Univ. Press, 2012).

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIrsl.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Is Homosexuality Unnatural? - John Corvino
description:
What does it mean when people call same-sex relations "unnatural," and why should that judgment matter anyway? Philosopher John Corvino takes apart this claim, demonstrating that, in the usual cases, it's empty rhetorical flourish.

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the co-author, with Maggie Gallagher, of the book Debating Same-Sex Marriage (Oxford Univ. Press, 2012).


SPECIAL THANKS to "Son of Thunder" for the Arabic subtitles.


Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIrsl.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: The Definition of Marriage - John Corvino
description:
Opponents of same-sex marriage often claim that same-sex "marriage" is impossible by definition: that marriage just MEANS a man and a woman. Here, John Corvino shows how this argument misunderstands both history and language.

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIrsl.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Is Gay Marriage a Threat to Religious Freedom? - John Corvino
description:
Opponents of same-sex marriage often argue that allowing gays to marry would threaten the religious freedom of those who oppose such unions. Here, John Corvino explains how this alleged threat is overblown—and how it has nothing to do with marriage law anyway.

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the co-author, with Maggie Gallagher, of the book Debating Same-Sex Marriage (Oxford Univ. Press, 2012).

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIrsl.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Do Children Need a Mother and Father? - John Corvino
description:
Some people oppose letting same-sex couples marry on the grounds that "children need a mother and father." John Corvino shows that this argument proceeds from what is not true (about child welfare) to what does not follow (about marriage law).

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the co-author, with Maggie Gallagher, of the book Debating Same-Sex Marriage (Oxford Univ. Press, 2012).

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIrsl.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Debunking the Regnerus Study - John Corvino
description:
A 2012 study by sociologist Mark Regnerus aims to show that children of same-sex parents fare differently—and indeed, markedly worse—than children in "intact biological families." John Corvino explains the study's major flaws.

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the co-author, with Maggie Gallagher, of the book Debating Same-Sex Marriage (Oxford Univ. Press, 2012).

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIrsl.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: If Gay Marriage, Why Not Polygamy? - John Corvino
description:
Opponents of same-sex marriage often ask, "If we allow gays to marry, why not polygamy? Why not incest?" and so on. Here, John Corvino exposes the fallacy in this slippery-slope argument.

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the co-author, with Maggie Gallagher, of the book Debating Same-Sex Marriage (Oxford Univ. Press, 2012).

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIrsl.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Why Marriage? (Why not Civil Unions?) - John Corvino
description:
Some people wonder why the fight for marriage rights is important to gays and lesbians, given marriage's spotty history. Others wonder why it's important to call it "marriage" -- aren't "civil unions" enough? John Corvino explains why the rights and responsibilities of marriage are important, and how "separate but equal" never really ends up being truly equal.

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the co-author, with Maggie Gallagher, of the book Debating Same-Sex Marriage (Oxford Univ. Press, 2012).


SPECIAL THANKS to "Son of Thunder" for the Arabic subtitles.


Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIrsl.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: Is Gay Marriage a Threat to Traditional Marriage? - John Corvino
description:
Marriage-equality opponents often argue that same-sex marriage proposes a threat to traditional marriage. John Corvino exposes how this unsubstantiated claim is highly implausible.

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the co-author, with Maggie Gallagher, of the book Debating Same-Sex Marriage (Oxford Univ. Press, 2012).

Find the book here: http://amzn.to/ZuIrsl.
Video by Chase Whiteside. Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.

title: TRAILER: What's Morally Wrong with Homosexuality? - John Corvino
description:
Extended Trailer for "What's Morally Wrong with Homosexuality." Full lecture available on YouTube at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5iXA_0MED98&feature=player_embedded, or on DVD at www.gaymoralist.com. 

Dr. John Corvino, also known as the "Gay Moralist," is a writer, speaker, and philosophy professor at Wayne State University in Detroit. He is the author of What's Wrong with Homosexuality? and the co-author (with Maggie Gallagher) of Debating Same-Sex Marriage, both from Oxford University Press.

Find the book version here: http://amzn.to/ZuIF2A.
Read more at http://JohnCorvino.com.
